question: 全力
sourceMnemonic: When you put <kanji>all</kanji> your <kanji>power</kanji> into something, you're putting your <vocabulary>full effort</vocabulary> into it. Hopefully that's what you put into your kanji learning as well!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>力</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

With your <vocabulary>full effort</vocabulary>, you were able to produce a <reading>Zen</reading> <reading>lock</reading> (<ja>ぜんりょく</ja>). It's a lock imbued with the power of Zen, meaning no one and nothing could possibly break it. It's the one lock to rule them all.
